data.text: A prayer of the prophet Habakkuk, with a song.
O Lord, I have heard thy report, and was afraid:
Before his face shall go a report,
The earth stood at his feet and trembled:
Because of troubles I looked upon the tents of the Ethiopians:
Wast thou angry, O Lord, with the rivers?
Surely thou didst bend thy bow
The nations shall see thee and be in pain,
The sun was exalted, and the moon stood still in her course:
Thou wilt bring low the land with threatening,
Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people,
Thou didst cut asunder the heads of princes with amazement,
And thou dost cause thy horses to enter the sea,
I watched, and my belly trembled
For though the fig tree shall bear no fruit,
Yet I will exult in the Lord,
The Lord God is my strength,
